abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed program would help the
            Government to provide crucial relief and rehabilitation
            services to alleviate the impact of drought and famine on
            human welfare.  The main objectives include supporting the
            recovery of peasant crop and livestock production; enabling
            the Government to cope with the drought situation and relief
            effort, as well as reducing the fiscal and balance of
            payments impact of the drought.  To achieve these
            objectives, the program would assist three key sectors:
            agriculture, transportation, and water supply.
            Specifically, the proposed program would fund 50,000 tons of
            fertilizer and US$2.0 million worth of plant protection
            chemicals and the same value of veterinary drugs and
            equipment for boosting 1985 agricultural production by
            peasant farmers.  It would also provide about 100 four-wheel
            drive trucks for the Relief and Rehabilitation Commission,
            for transporting food from main stores to rural distribution
            centers as well as spare parts for maintaining the public
            and private truck fleet.  Furthermore, the program would
            fund water pumps, motors and generators to repair about 170
            mechanized and 800 hand-operated wells and boreholes in the
            drought areas; and two drill rigs with ancillary equipment
            for constructing potable water supplies.
